A fantastic place, and fantastic food (not least the local Sri Lankan food). But the staff is what makes this place something really special.

Amazing location by the beach with delicious food at any time of the day, breakfast, lunch and dinner. 

There‚Äôs a wide choice of dishes for all tastes,  whether you like vegeterian, meat or traditional seafood dishes.

The prices might seem high at first but the...servings were big, so overall fair prices.

The staff and restaurant  head were very kind, polite and attentive, we made many friends he servings were big, so overall fair prices.

The staff and restaurant  head were very kind, polite and attentive, we made many friends here.
Sea food plate and  also auhentic Sri Lankan curry, everything is good in the restaurant.  They serve double sea food plates, with a lot of crabs, langoustines etc.

My friend and I had dinner here both on Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve.  Absolutely incredible experience.  Good food and good service.  Since it was during two holidays, they had a little extra entertainment and music.  Really recommend a visit here.

We were recommended this restaurant but in all honesty it is nothing special and quite pricey for Sri Lanka. Our mezzo platter starter of humous was good but main courses were tasteless and disappointing. Not really worth the effort of finding it etc

Absolutely wonderful food. Our tour group of 15 people all raved about their food. I had seafood and it was beautifully cooked. The pizza proved a lovely break from traditional curries. Service was very attentive and could not be faulted. I was very impressed.
Fab restaurant, right on the beach and perfect location for watching the sunset. Had Fish in Banana Leaf, wow, fantastic flavour, you‚Äôve got to try it

We saw the recommendation on Tripadvisor and thought we would try it , I‚Äôm glad we did . Well, 2 years on from the pandemic and I finally had the pleasure of returning to coco la mer. 

Still easily the best restaurant in Unawatuna in a lovely, beachside setting and with an extensive menu. 

Local specialities, seafood and international options are all available....Brilliant cocktails and a comprehensive wine list sit alongside the food offering. 

Service is still exemplary.

Yes, still the best upmarket fine dining in Unawatu Brilliant cocktails and a comprehensive wine list sit alongside the food offering. 

Service is still exemplary.

Yes, still the best upmarket fine dining in Unawatuna!

I love Unawatuna, great location, good bars and many restaurants. However there is a distinct lack of upmarket restaurants.

CocoBay La Mer solves that.

This romantic restaurant, with amble tables both inside and outside is the perfect location for a romantic last night meal.

The...food is excellent and the service lives up to it's setting and the quality of the food.

An extensive wine list sits alongside an impressive coctail selection.

Overall very highly recommended. You wont be disapoint food is excellent and the service lives up to it's setting and the quality of the food.

Overall very highly recommended. You wont be disapointed!

We chose La Mer as outside guests because of the great reviews, and we can tell you they are all true. Firstly, our host Dileepa was an absolute charm and made us very comfortable. We've had experiences eating in hotel restaurants as outside guests before...that were less than pleasant, but here there is no such discrimination. They gave us a great spot right on the beach, which brings us to our second point: the view. The sun had just set, and the brilliant red skies, the burning torches on the beach and the sight of Galle in the distance made for such a dramatic spectacle. Thirdly then, and most importantly, the food. We had a mixed seafood platter for two, and we have had several of these all over Sri Lanka, and we can safely say it was the best we've had. Fresh, great variety, supremely cooked and great complementary sauces. 
The only minor little detail was that the drinks were a little expensive, and the glass of wine was fairly small for that price. 
Other than that, absolutely loved it. Great experience. Special thanks to Dilee that were less than pleasant, but here there is no such discrimination. This is a favourite restaurant of ours but our experience last night was one of the best yet. The atmosphere was great with a live band luring us in, the food was as usual delicious and full of flavour and the cocktails were great. The...personal and professional service was fabulous and the owner Natasha remembered us from previous visits and went out of her way to spend time chatting to us. All in all it was a great evening and we will visit again so personal and professional service was fabulous and the owner Natasha remembered us from previous visits and went out of her way to spend time chatting to us. Our dinner ended with the owner saying she has a problem with "certain kind of people" and when asked is she referring to Indians or South Asians she said "Yes"

We were a large group of 6 adults and 4 children.  The staff first of...all refused seating and when we pointed out empty tables they finally agreed but gave us a 7 seater table. They refused to join tables for our seating while others received it freely. Orders were considerably delayed. My daughter ordered a dish with some Avocado and 5 mins later when we wanted to order an extra serving of Avocado (with us paying for it) owner suddenly said all Avocados are finished as they have made Guacamole from all of it!!........It is scarcely beleiveable that in 5 mins flat all Avocados were finished.....in fact we even saw avocados being served with other dishes even an hour after our request was turrned down. This is just some of the bad experiences we had.

When we went to give some calm and honest feedback the owner started accusing us and said she has always has a problem with "certain kind of people" and has been more than "generous". Other hotel staff also came and started shouting.

This kind of racist behaviour lacking in basic human courtesy and going against every tenet of hospitality is very much not acceptable, specially in today's day and age.

Would advise all South Asians to stay away from a racist establishment like this.

Best dinner and drinks I ever had. I was actually shocked having travelled all over, this was hands down the best tacos and freshest margarita I‚Äôve ever had. We came back the next morning for round 2!

We went for taco Tuesday...and tried 6 different tacos. They were so good we ended up going back 2 more times before our trip ended. The margaritas are wonderful, they have several to choose from. The best prawn curry in Sri Lanka. The food was top class - quality ingredients, cooked to perfection.

The service is great ther waiters Terrance and Binishka did our experience great!! We will be back for sure! Lobster was not so good, prawns and calamari excelent!!

Went to the Daffodil restaurant on a recommendation from my son. Outside, a beautiful display of the days catch, red snapper, jumbo prawns , lobster and crabs and more....Inside greeted by Rahji, the owner, and served with a drink while we waited for a table....ordered...our food and what food it was, all very very fresh and very tasty...the red snapper was particularly delicious. The drinks were good, cold Lion beer for me and passion fruit mojitos for my wife....live music from a very good local musician and very attentive service from the myriad of waiters..So good was the meal/evening that we returned for the next 2 nights and will be back next February.
If youre in Unawatuna and like fish be sure to visit the  Daffodil, you'll not be disappointed.....all the tuc tuc drivers know where it is  and its probably best to reserve a table to be sure of getting in...

Absolutely loved the place.! Very crispy and cheesy aranchini with beautiful pesto. The wood fire pizza was so good where to the extent my not eating pizza husband devored 3/4 of it. La Boheme is a 10 minute walk from the Main Street of Unawatuna, where we were greeted by some incredibly friendly staff. They had recognised us from the morning visit. We wanted to check it was open due to it being the full moon festival...and it being the off-season.

There was a fantastic range of pizzas, pastas and appetisers. While the pricing was more expensive than the usual dining in Sri Lanka, the pizza size made up for it. As a couple, I would recommend either only having 2 pizzas (no starters) or having one pizza to share and have starters!
